code:
export var questionObj = {
  "Qtext": "
 Find the mean of the following distribution by \\
 (i) direct method \indent (ii) short cut method \indent (iii) step-deviation method\\
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \(\cellcolor{blue!25}Class-intervals\) & 93 - 99 & 99 - 105 & 105 - 111 & 111 - 117 & 117 - 123 \\
 \hline
 \(\cellcolor{blue!25}Frequency\) & 14 & 15 & 2 & 12 & 5 \\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
",
  "Steps": [{
    "id": "s1",
    "n_params": 0,
    "step_txt": "(i) Direct method
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25}$Classes$ & Class mark $y_i$ & Frequency $f_i$ & $f_iy_i$ \\
 \hline
 93 - 99 & 96 & 14 & 1344\\
 \hline
 99 - 105 & 102 & 15 & 1530\\
 \hline
 105 - 111 & 108 & 2 & 216\\
 \hline
 111 - 117 & 114 & 12 & 1368\\
 \hline
 117 - 123 & 120 & 5 & 600\\
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25} Total & & 48 & 5058\\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
 \begin{align*}
 Mean & = \dfrac{\Sigma f_i y_i}{\Sigma f_i} \\
 & = \dfrac{5058}{48} = 105.38
 \end{align*}
 (ii) Short cut method
 Construct the table as under, taking a = 108\\
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25}$Classes$ & Class mark $y_i$ & deviatioin $d_i=y_i-a$ & Frequency $f_i$ & $f_id_i$ \\
 \hline
 93 - 99 & 96 & -12 & 14 & -168\\
 \hline
 99 - 105 & 102 & -6 & 15 & -90\\
 \hline
 105 - 111 & 108 & 0 & 2 & 0\\
 \hline
 111 - 117 & 114 & 6 & 12 & 72\\
 \hline
 117 - 123 & 120 & 12 & 5 & 60\\
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25} Total & & & 48 & -126\\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
 \begin{align*}
 Mean & = a + \dfrac{\Sigma f_i d_i}{\Sigma f_i} \\
 & = 108 + \dfrac{-126}{48} = 105.38
 \end{align*}
 (iii) Step deviation method
 Construct the table as under, taking a = 108\\
 Here, $c=6$\\
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25}$Classes$ & Class mark $y_i$ & $u_i=\dfrac{y_i-a}{c}$ & Frequency $f_i$ & $f_iu_i$ \\
 \hline
 93 - 99 & 96 & -2 & 14 & -28\\
 \hline
 99 - 105 & 102 & -1 & 15 & -15\\
 \hline
 105 - 111 & 108 & 0 & 2 & 0\\
 \hline
 111 - 117 & 114 & 1 & 12 & 12\\
 \hline
 117 - 123 & 120 & 2 & 5 & 10\\
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25} Total & & & 48 & -21\\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
 \begin{align*}
 Mean & = a + c \times \dfrac{\Sigma f_i u_i}{\Sigma f_i} \\
 & = 108 + 6 \times \dfrac{-21}{48} = 105.38
 \end{align*}
"
  }]
};
export var resp = [{
  "data": [],
  "text": " "
}];

sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 Find the mean of the following distribution by \\
 (i) direct method \indent (ii) short cut method \indent (iii) step-deviation method\\
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \(\cellcolor{blue!25}Class-intervals\) & 93 - 99 & 99 - 105 & 105 - 111 & 111 - 117 & 117 - 123 \\
 \hline
 \(\cellcolor{blue!25}Frequency\) & 14 & 15 & 2 & 12 & 5 \\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "(i) Direct method
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25}$Classes$ & Class mark $y_i$ & Frequency $f_i$ & $f_iy_i$ \\
 \hline
 93 - 99 & 96 & 14 & 1344\\
 \hline
 99 - 105 & 102 & 15 & 1530\\
 \hline
 105 - 111 & 108 & 2 & 216\\
 \hline
 111 - 117 & 114 & 12 & 1368\\
 \hline
 117 - 123 & 120 & 5 & 600\\
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25} Total & & 48 & 5058\\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
 \begin{align*}
 Mean & = \dfrac{\Sigma f_i y_i}{\Sigma f_i} \\
 & = \dfrac{5058}{48} = 105.38
 \end{align*}
 (ii) Short cut method
 Construct the table as under, taking a = 108\\
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25}$Classes$ & Class mark $y_i$ & deviatioin $d_i=y_i-a$ & Frequency $f_i$ & $f_id_i$ \\
 \hline
 93 - 99 & 96 & -12 & 14 & -168\\
 \hline
 99 - 105 & 102 & -6 & 15 & -90\\
 \hline
 105 - 111 & 108 & 0 & 2 & 0\\
 \hline
 111 - 117 & 114 & 6 & 12 & 72\\
 \hline
 117 - 123 & 120 & 12 & 5 & 60\\
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25} Total & & & 48 & -126\\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
 \begin{align*}
 Mean & = a + \dfrac{\Sigma f_i d_i}{\Sigma f_i} \\
 & = 108 + \dfrac{-126}{48} = 105.38
 \end{align*}
 (iii) Step deviation method
 Construct the table as under, taking a = 108\\
 Here, $c=6$\\
 \begin{table}[h!]
 \centering
 \addtolength{\tabcolsep}{1pt}
 \begin{tabular}{ |c|c|c|c|c| }
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25}$Classes$ & Class mark $y_i$ & $u_i=\dfrac{y_i-a}{c}$ & Frequency $f_i$ & $f_iu_i$ \\
 \hline
 93 - 99 & 96 & -2 & 14 & -28\\
 \hline
 99 - 105 & 102 & -1 & 15 & -15\\
 \hline
 105 - 111 & 108 & 0 & 2 & 0\\
 \hline
 111 - 117 & 114 & 1 & 12 & 12\\
 \hline
 117 - 123 & 120 & 2 & 5 & 10\\
 \hline
 \rowcolor{blue!25} Total & & & 48 & -21\\
 \hline
 \end{tabular}
 \end{table}
 \begin{align*}
 Mean & = a + c \times \dfrac{\Sigma f_i u_i}{\Sigma f_i} \\
 & = 108 + 6 \times \dfrac{-21}{48} = 105.38
 \end{align*}
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
